name: interoceptive

relating to interoception (= the feeling of knowing what is happening in your body, for example if you are hungry, thirsty, warm, cold, etc.): The interoceptive system gives us the ability to feel what is happening inside our body. Interoceptive awareness heightens awareness of bodily cues that a panic attack may soon happen.
More examplesFewer examplesMindfulness is shown to activate the insula, the interoceptive centre in the brain. Children will also differ in their exposure to interoceptive emotional information.Superimposed upon this diurnal pattern is activation by interoceptive and exteroceptive cues relating to threat.
